channel.title: [317] Amulet of glory-please help, well appreciated
channel.description:
I've looked all over google, all over several forums and I cannot find a tutorial to add amulet of glory. I'm looking to make it so when I click rub on an amulet of glory, the interface comes up in the dialogue and it has the teleports... I'm pretty sure it has something to do with case 185... I've tried playing around with the codes and such and have the methods coded already... I just don't know where to activate a third click on an item. Help please?
[b]Maybe someone direct me to a tutorial link?[/b]

item.title: [317] Amulet of glory-please help, well appreciated
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

[quote=“dmannn0120, post:12, topic:436309”][quote author=Tutorial link=topic=539029.msg3946497#msg3946497 date=1331920839]

Also, I don’t have a second click class sadly. -__-" I searched in my client.java for a second click item method as well and nothing was to be found for that, I can’t even think of an item in my source that uses a second click. Any suggestions? Well appreciated.

Do you even have first click class? BTW, it will not be a method inside of client.java. It might be in the folder that contains the packets.
[/quote]

Yes I have a seperate class for first click items, handles potions, runecrafting pouches, food eating, etc.[/quote]

Well, create a new method for clickitem2 and 3.

Read full topic
item.source: [317] Amulet of glory-please help, well appreciated

item.title: [317] Amulet of glory-please help, well appreciated
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

dmannn0120:

Also, I don’t have a second click class sadly. -__-" I searched in my client.java for a second click item method as well and nothing was to be found for that, I can’t even think of an item in my source that uses a second click. Any suggestions? Well appreciated.

Do you even have first click class? BTW, it will not be a method inside of client.java. It might be in the folder that contains the packets.

Edit: NVM, saw that you have Delta. I can’t help you anymore because I don’t know how Delta is packaged, sorry.

Read full topic
item.source: [317] Amulet of glory-please help, well appreciated

item.title: [317] Amulet of glory-please help, well appreciated
item.dc:creator: @dmannn0120 dmannn0120
item.description:
@dmannn0120 wrote:

[quote=“Skiire, post:9, topic:436309”][quote author=dmannn0120 link=topic=539029.msg3946472#msg3946472 date=1331919212]

	public void glory() {
		interfaceEffect = 7;
		clearQuestInterface();
		sendFrame126("Edgeville", 2494);
		sendFrame126("Karamja", 2495);
		sendFrame126("Draynor Village", 2496);
		sendFrame126("Al Kharid", 2497);
		sendQuestSomething(8143);
		sendFrame164(2492);
		flushOutStream();
	}

Then in your client class in the secondClickItem method call that for each glory (dependent on charges).

Yeah, I have this method… Yet the glory is not activated by a second click. The second click is operate and I believe that is only in a 525, I think… I’m using 317 so there is only a third click option for an amulet of glory. I have all the methods to make the glory work, but I can’t find where to activate a third click for any item. So when I right click the glory, there is no operate option, there is only a rub option. Which is the third click.
[/quote]

You do learn something new everyday.

Anyways, sorry I didn’t know that.

OT: Just do what Tutorial said.[/quote]

No problem dude thanks for trying to help, appreciate it.

Tutorial:

I would imagine copying and pasting the second click class and renaming it to third click class would work, since they both perform the same function. Then again, that is the easy way.

Also, I don’t have a second click class sadly. -__-" I searched in my client.java for a second click item method as well and nothing was to be found for that, I can’t even think of an item in my source that uses a second click. Any suggestions? Well appreciated.

Read full topic
item.source: [317] Amulet of glory-please help, well appreciated
